title: Third victim in Habersham County shootings identified
content:
HABERSHAM COUNTY, GA (CBS46) -
A man shot and killed Sunday night in Habersham County has been identified.
The Georgia Bureau of Investigation identified him as Steve Singleton, 45.
When deputies arrived at the home on Lower Pond Court, deputies saw a speeding car coming toward them.
The man, identified as Anthony Giaquinta, got out of the vehicle and ran into a wooded area. After a brief search, deputies continued to the house where the 911 call originated from.
When Habersham County Sheriff Joey Terrell and Deputy Bill Zigan entered the garage, they found Kathy Giaquinta Smith dead.
Shortly thereafter, Anthony Giaquinta shot Terrell and Zigan. Terrell was shot once in the arm and Zigan was hit multiple times.
Terrell and Zigan were able to return fire, ultimately leading to Anthony Giaquinta's death. The GBI said there was no evidence of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Police said the suspect was later found dead behind his home. During a search of the property, Singleton's body was found.
Singleton and Kathy Giaquinta Smith were friends.
Anthony and Kathy Giaquinta's 16-year-old daughter and her boyfriend were at home at the time and made the 911 call after seeing her father with a gun and hearing gunshots. Neither were injured.
The Giaquintas also have an 18-year-old daughter who is away at college.
CBS46.com will have more information as it becomes available.
